p: Concerning the two HBsAg-positive patients, the one diagnosed by the EAS had a detectable viral load (154 IU/mL), and antiviral prophylaxis with nucleos(t)ide analogues (NUCs) was prescribed. The other patient had HBeAg-negative chronic hepatitis and was already receiving a NUC, which was maintained. From the 57 anti-HBc positive patients, 47 were diagnosed after the EAS and 25 (53.2%) received prophylaxis with NUCs.
